title: Can't choose location for downloads
content:
Hello!

I have downloaded Firefox but I cannot chose a location for my downloads when using the browser - so all of my downloads are failing. I am using a Macbook and currently have no location for my downloads. Even when I click the "Choose" button under Preferences, nothing pops up and I have no options to select. I also cannot type into the "Save files to" section.

Any help is welcome, thank you!
creator: jennyle2020

title: How do I recover firefox(cache and cookies) ?
content:
I have not turn off the PC yet and just clear all the data last 2hours.

I tried this and it shows history only 1. Press Windows + R, type cmd and click OK. Or you can also type cmd in the Windows search bar. 2. Open Command Prompt, type ipconfig /displaydns, and press Enter. Now, you can see the recently visited websites. You can view, copy & paste the important websites into Firefox, and save them as bookmarks.

Why? because when login with rnc@#!3@!@gmail.com it ask for phone prompt again basically do not ask this device all gone!


I keep advice said when clearing cookies and cache all data will gone he say ok and proceed to regret please help.
creator: johnchong.rnc

title: YouTube - full screen not working from theather mode
content:
I am not fluent in English, there may be errors in translation.

When changing from theater mode to full screen, a black screen is displayed and the screen does not appear.

creator: ppp821203

title: Youtube displays black screen when trying to fullscreen
content: Whenever I try to fullscreen a Youtube video, it just displays a black screen. It is not temporary, and the picture never loads in. I have tried the full-screen-api solution. Didn't work. I tried deleting my cache and cookies. Didn't work. I tried disabling hardware acceleration. Didn't work. I restarted my machine twice, and that didn't work And I am on the most recent version of Firefox.
creator: brian.t.dussault

title: Firefox dropping sound from internet video plays fine no sound Windowes 11
content: When connected to sites that have video YouTube, rumble, video plays fine but no sound. I have had this problem before and fixed it. I found a place where Firefox could be selected to hook to the internet, Now I can't seem to find this place again.
